page.title: 01The Cairn Village,Loch Ryan
page.content: Cairnryan village is situated east of the A77 road (Glasgow-Portpatrick). The main employers are Townsend Thoresen who operate the cross channel ferry service between the ports of Cairnryan and Lorne, Northern Ireland and to a lesser extent Cairnryan Breakers Yard where such naval ships as Ark Royal, Eagle and Bulwark were 'cut up'. Almost all the workforce comes from the village of Cairnryan. The Cairn Hill overlooks the village and part of the hill is being quarried by a local firm supplying 'bottoming' for road construction in southwest Scotland. The remainder of the land scape is mainly trees and farmlands used for grazing and mild produce.
